skill.name: openapi-spec-generation
skill.description: Generate and maintain OpenAPI 3.1 specifications from code, design-first specs, and validation patterns. Use when creating API documentation, generating SDKs, or ensuring API contract compliance.
skill.summary: Generate and maintain OpenAPI 3.1 specifications from code, design-first specs, and validation patte...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and template skill containing YAML OpenAPI specifications, code examples (Python FastAPI, TypeScript tsoa), and validation patterns. No executable code, no file access, no network calls. Contains only documentation and templates for users to reference.

content.value_statement: Creating and maintaining API documentation is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill provides comprehensive templates, code examples, and validation patterns for OpenAPI 3.1 specifications to streamline API documentation workflows.
actual_capabilities: Generate complete OpenAPI 3.1 specification templates with paths, schemas, and components
Create API specifications from Python FastAPI code using automatic OpenAPI generation
Generate OpenAPI specs from TypeScript Express code using tsoa decorators
Validate specifications using Spectral and Redocly linting tools
Generate client SDKs in multiple languages from OpenAPI specs
limitations: Does not execute or validate specifications automatically
Does not connect to external APIs or documentation services
Does not modify existing project files
Requires manual integration of provided templates into your codebase

use_cases.title: Create API Specifications
use_cases.description: Design and document REST APIs with complete OpenAPI 3.1 templates including schemas, examples, and security schemes.

use_cases.title: Code-First Documentation
use_cases.description: Generate OpenAPI specs from existing FastAPI or Express/tsoa codebases for automatic SDK generation.

use_cases.title: Validate API Contracts
use_cases.description: Set up linting rules and validation pipelines to ensure API specifications meet quality and compliance standards.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Spec
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an OpenAPI 3.1 specification template for a [RESOURCE] API with CRUD endpoints, authentication, and error responses.

prompt_templates.title: Code-First
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Python FastAPI code example that generates an OpenAPI specification for user management with pagination and filtering.

prompt_templates.title: Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Write Spectral validation rules for OpenAPI specs that enforce operation IDs, descriptions, and security definitions.

prompt_templates.title: SDK Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate an OpenAPI Generator command to create a TypeScript client from an OpenAPI specification file.

output_examples.input: Create an OpenAPI specification for a product catalog API
output: Product schema with id, name, price, description, category

best_practices: Use $ref for reusable schemas, parameters, and responses to maintain consistency across specifications
Include real-world examples in request and response schemas to help API consumers understand usage
Define all possible error responses including validation errors, authentication failures, and rate limiting
anti_patterns: Avoid generic or missing descriptions on operations, parameters, and schema properties
Do not skip defining security schemes even for internal APIs
Avoid hardcoding server URLs in paths; use server variables for different environments

faq.question: What programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: Templates cover Python FastAPI, TypeScript with tsoa, and plain YAML for any language. SDK generation supports 50+ languages.

faq.question: What are the size limits for OpenAPI specifications?
faq.answer: OpenAPI specs have no hard size limit but tools may have practical limits. Large specs should be split using $ref for maintainability.

faq.question: How do I integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Use Spectral CLI or Redocly in CI to validate specs. Add pre-commit hooks to ensure specifications pass linting before deployment.

faq.question: Is my API specification data kept private?
faq.answer: This skill runs locally with no network access. Your specifications remain on your machine and are never transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why is my specification not generating expected endpoints?
faq.answer: Check that paths follow OpenAPI format with HTTP methods nested under path items. Verify schemas are correctly referenced with $ref.

faq.question: How does this compare to Swagger Editor?
faq.answer: Swagger Editor provides interactive editing. This skill provides templates and patterns you can copy into any editor or CI pipeline.
